timeline.ehr_excerpt: Patient reports intermittent chest pain and shortness of breath with exertion over 2 weeks.

findings: Patient reports intermittent chest pain and shortness of breath with exertion over 2 weeks.

Chest pain documented in recent EHR narrative
notes: No genotype assertions included by reporter policy
No literature-based assertions included by reporter policy
MedGemma enabled but inference fallback was applied

interpretations: Variant hypothesis: AGT, c.803T>C, heterozygous (Medium confidence)

caveats: Genotype findings are supportive and must be integrated with phenotype and imaging
Insufficient evidence remains possible and should be explicitly reported

evidence_items.quote_or_summary:
# Record 1
Pmid: 39962183
Pmcid: PMC11832766
Title:
  Association between ACTN3 (R577X), BDKRB2 (-9/+9) and AGT (M235T)
  polymorphisms and physical performance in Brazilian junior handball
  players
Journal: Sci Rep
Date: 2025-02-17T00:00:00Z
Doi: 10.1038/s41598-025-90684-y
Abstract:
  Team handball performance relies on physical and technical abilities,
  influenced by environmental and genetic factors. Variants in ACTN3 R577X
  (rs1815739), BDKRB2 -9/+9 (rs5810761), and AGT Met235Thr (rs699) genes
  are associated with athletic performance, but their relevance in
  handball remains unclear. Therefore, this study aimed to investigate the
  association of these polymorphisms with physical p

# Record 1
Pmid: 40454940
Pmcid: PMC12191924
Title: A new naphthalene-based fluorogenic substrate for cytochrome P450 4A11
Journal: Biochem J
Date: 2025-05-30T00:00:00Z
Doi: 10.1042/BCJ20253130
Abstract:
  We aimed to create a high-throughput fluorimetric assay for the activity
  of CYP4A11, the major 20-HETE-producing enzyme. To this end, we probed
  3-(6-methoxynaphthalen-2-yl)acrylic acid (MONACRA) as a potential
  CYP4A11 substrate. We studied its metabolism using human liver
  microsomes (HLM) and recombinant P450 enzymes. O-demethylation of
  MONACRA by cytochromes P450 creates 3-(6-hydroxynaphthalen-2-yl)acrylic
  acid. The bright fluorescence of the product and its clear spectral
  r

actionability_caveats: No therapeutic action should be based on genotype alone
Conflict across sources should downgrade confidence

output.subjective: Patient reports intermittent chest pain and shortness of breath with exertion over 2 weeks.
output.objective: CT | chest | Mild bibasilar atelectatic change. No focal consolidation.; Chest pain documented in recent EHR narrative; Dyspnea/shortness of breath documented; Labs available: 1; Vitals available: 1
output.assessment: Possible acute coronary syndrome (hypothesis); Possible cardiopulmonary decompensation (hypothesis); Genotype interpretation included as supporting evidence only
output.plan: Correlate symptoms with objective findings and timeline; Prioritize evidence-backed differential items; Collect missing objective data for unresolved uncertainty; Keep genotype-dependent recommendations caveated
open_questions: What key negatives are still missing?
Any temporal mismatch between symptoms and imaging findings?
Any high-risk recommendation lacking strong evidence?

output.claim_text: Differential includes: Possible acute coronary syndrome (hypothesis)

# Record 1
Pmid: 39962183
Pmcid: PMC11832766
Title:
  Association between ACTN3 (R577X), BDKRB2 (-9/+9) and AGT (M235T)
  polymorphisms and physical performance in Brazilian junior handball
  players
Journal: Sci Rep
Date: 2025-02-17T00:00:00Z
Doi: 10.1038/s41598-025-90684-y
Abstract:
  Team handball performance relies on physical and technical abilities,
  influenced by environmental and genetic factors. Variants in ACTN3 R577X
  (rs1815739), BDKRB2 -9/+9 (rs5810761), and AGT Met235Thr (rs699) genes
  are associated with athletic performance, but their relevance in
  handball remains unclear. Therefore, this study aimed to investigate the
  association of these polymorphisms with physical p

# Record 1
Pmid: 40454940
Pmcid: PMC12191924
Title: A new naphthalene-based fluorogenic substrate for cytochrome P450 4A11
Journal: Biochem J
Date: 2025-05-30T00:00:00Z
Doi: 10.1042/BCJ20253130
Abstract:
  We aimed to create a high-throughput fluorimetric assay for the activity
  of CYP4A11, the major 20-HETE-producing enzyme. To this end, we probed
  3-(6-methoxynaphthalen-2-yl)acrylic acid (MONACRA) as a potential
  CYP4A11 substrate. We studied its metabolism using human liver
  microsomes (HLM) and recombinant P450 enzymes. O-demethylation of
  MONACRA by cytochromes P450 creates 3-(6-hydroxynaphthalen-2-yl)acrylic
  acid. The bright fluorescence of the product and its clear spectral
  r

  Association between ACTN3 (R577X), BDKRB2 (-9/+9) and AGT (M235T)
  polymorphisms and physical performance in Brazilian junior handball
  players
Journal: Sci Rep
Date: 2025-02-17T00:00:00Z
Doi: 10.1038/s41598-025-90684-y
Abstract:
  Team handball performance relies on physical and technical abilities,
  influenced by environmental and genetic factors. Variants in ACTN3 R577X
  (rs1815739), BDKRB2 -9/+9 (rs5810761), and AGT Met235Thr (rs699) genes
  are associated with athletic performance, but their relevance in
  handball remains unclear. Therefore, this study aimed to investigate the
  association of these polymorphisms with physical p

Doi: 10.1042/BCJ20253130

  We aimed to create a high-throughput fluorimetric assay for the activity
  of CYP4A11, the major 20-HETE-producing enzyme. To this end, we probed
  3-(6-methoxynaphthalen-2-yl)acrylic acid (MONACRA) as a potential
  CYP4A11 substrate. We studied its metabolism using human liver

  MONACRA by cytochromes P450 creates 3-(6-hydroxynaphthalen-2-yl)acrylic
  acid. The bright fluorescence of the product and its clear spectral

output.soap_final:
S: Patient reports intermittent chest pain and shortness of breath with exertion over 2 weeks.
O: CT | chest | Mild bibasilar atelectatic change. No focal consolidation.; Chest pain documented in recent EHR narrative; Dyspnea/shortness of breath documented; Labs available: 1; Vitals available: 1
A: Possible acute coronary syndrome (hypothesis); Possible cardiopulmonary decompensation (hypothesis); Genotype interpretation included as supporting evidence only; Verifier-requested updates addressed
P: Correlate symptoms with objective findings and timeline; Prioritize evidence-backed differential items; Collect missing objective data for unresolved uncertainty; Apply verifier patch list before release; Keep genotype-dependent recommendations caveated

findings: Patient reports intermittent chest pain and shortness of breath with exertion over 2 weeks.

Chest pain documented in recent EHR narrative
notes: Revision focus applied: High-stakes narrative requires stronger objective grounding and explicit negatives.
No genotype assertions included by reporter policy
No literature-based assertions included by reporter policy
MedGemma enabled but inference fallback was applied

interpretations: Variant hypothesis: AGT, c.803T>C, heterozygous (Medium confidence)
